definitions.definition: Having light; bright ; clear ; not dark or obscure .
examples: The room is light when the Sun shines through the window.

definitions.definition: Pale or whitish in color ; highly luminous and more or less deficient in chroma .
( of coffee ) Served with extra milk or cream.

main_definition: Having light; bright ; clear ; not dark or obscure .
secondary_definitions: Pale or whitish in color ; highly luminous and more or less deficient in chroma .
( of coffee ) Served with extra milk or cream.

definitions.definition: Having little or relatively little actual weight ; not cumbrous or unwieldy .
examples: a light load ; a lighter backpack after having removed the books ; light weapons

definitions.definition: Having little weight as compared with bulk ; of little density or specific gravity .
examples: feathers and cork are light ; oil is lighter than water

definitions.definition: Of short or insufficient weight; weighing less than the legal , standard , or proper amount; clipped or diminished .
Lacking that which burdens or makes heavy.

subdefinitions.definition: Free from burden or impediment ; unencumbered .
Lightly built; typically designed for speed or small loads.
examples: a light aircraft ; a light tank

subdefinitions.definition: Not heavily armed ; armed with light weapons .
examples: light infantry; a troop of light horse

subdefinitions.definition: Riding high because of no cargo ; by extension, pertaining to a ship which is light.
examples: if a ship is light or partially loaded ; the light draft of a vessel, or its light displacement

subdefinitions.definition: Without any piece of equipment attached or attached only to a caboose .
examples: the light locomotives ; a locomotive may be moved light
labels: of a locomotive or consist of locomotives
subdefinitions.label_groups: rail transport , of a locomotive or consist of locomotives

definitions.definition: Not heavy or soggy ; spongy ; well raised .
examples: a light bread ; sponge cake is a light cake

definitions.definition: Low in fat, calories, alcohol, salt, etc.
examples: This light beer still gets you drunk if you have enough of it.

definitions.definition: Slight , not forceful or intense; small in amount or intensity.
examples: a light drizzle//a light rain was falling//a light snow set in

definitions.definition: Gentle; having little force or momentum.
examples: This artist clearly had a light , flowing touch.

definitions.definition: Easy to endure or perform.
Unimportant, trivial , having little value or significance.
examples: I made some light comment, and we moved on.

definitions.definition: Unchaste , wanton .
Not encumbered; unembarrassed; clear of impediments; hence, active; nimble; swift.
Easily influenced by trifling considerations; unsteady; unsettled; volatile.
Indulging in, or inclined to, levity; lacking dignity or solemnity; frivolous; airy.
examples: Ogden Nash was a writer of light verse.

definitions.definition: Not quite sound or normal; somewhat impaired or deranged; dizzy; giddy.
Easily interrupted by stimulation.
Cheerful .

secondary_definitions: Having little weight as compared with bulk ; of little density or specific gravity .
Of short or insufficient weight; weighing less than the legal , standard , or proper amount; clipped or diminished .
Lacking that which burdens or makes heavy.
